intro: Axinaea speciosa, commonly known as the showy axinaea, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a waxy texture. Axinaea speciosa is typically found growing in shaded, humid environments at higher elevations.
